result.execSummary:
The defendant George A Eskridge was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay restitution in the amount of $14.46 payable to the victim, Debra H. and $10.00 payable to the victim Janice B., JOINT AND SEVERAL with the co-actors, Lonell Echols (15CF2285) and Brian Echols (15CF2287).

BOTH COUNTS: Provide a DNA sample; pay DNA surcharge. Pay the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges. The court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges including the restitution surcharge be paid through collection by the DOC's from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a conditions of ES. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program, IF DEEMED APPROPRIATE BY WISCONSIN DEPT. OF CORRECTIONS
Concurrent with: Count 2, credit for 285 days time served

superMiscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
- No Contact with the victims or their families.
- No Contact with the co-actors, Lonell echols and Brian Echols.
- Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: - No possession of firearms or weapons of any kind. Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Concurrent with: Count 1, credit for 285 days time served

records.addlTxt:
Defendant George A Eskridge in court with attorney Michael Hart.  Defendant George A Eskridge in custody.  Karl Peter Hayes for Antoni Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

 Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:   The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 12-1/2 YEARS, concurrent to Count #2.
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 7-1/2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 5 YEARS. 
Credit given for 285 days time served.

AS TO COUNT 2:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 10 YEARS, concurrent to Count #1.
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 5 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 5 YEARS.
Credit given for 285 days time served.

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program, IF DEEMED APPROPRIATE BY WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program , IF DEEMED APPROPRIATE BY WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS.

CONDITIONS FOR EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2):  
* Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
* No contact with the victims or their families.
* No contact with the co-actors, Lonell Echols and Brian Echols.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  The Court ordered that all court costs, fees,  and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge.  The Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $14.46 payable to the victim, Debra H. - JOINT & SEVERAL with the co-actors, Lonell Echols (15CF2285) and Brian Echols (15CF2287).  The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $10.00 payable to the victim, Janice B. - JOINT & SEVERAL with the co-actors, Lonell Echols (15CF2285) and Brian Echols (15CF2287).  The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* No possession of firearms or weapons of any kind.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant George A Eskridge in court with attorney Michael Hart.  Defendant George A Eskridge in custody.  Karl Peter Hayes for Antoni Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count #3 dismissed and read-in for sentencing purposes.

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

Attorney Michael Hart in court, defendant George A Eskridge not in court, in custody.  Antoni Joseph Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

PER THE PERMISSION OF JUDGE DONALD AND HIS UNAVAILABILITY, CLERK ADJOURNED TODAY'S PLEA AND SENTENCING HEARING OFF THE RECORD.

Judge Donald is unavailable today.
Case adjourned to 02-26-2016 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.
**Upon stipulation of the parties, clerk CANCELED the 01-19-2016 at 8:30 AM Jury Trial date before Judge Donald's Court.

Attorney Michael Hart in court, defendant George A Eskridge not in court, in custody.  Antoni Joseph Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

PER THE PERMISSION OF JUDGE DONALD, CLERK ADJOURNED TODAY'S FINAL PRETRIAL CONFERENCE OFF THE RECORD.

Parties have reached an agreement, however, State needs time for victim notification.
Case adjourned to 01-13-2016 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.
**Judge Donald approved the next court date.

Defendant George A Eskridge in court with attorney Michael Hart.  Defendant George A Eskridge in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Upon oral motion by the State, Court amends the criminal complaint to reflect the corrections of "Glendale" and "May 17, 2015" as to Counts 2 and 3 on page 1. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defense Counsel is requesting an Arraignment date before the Court.   Arraignment for June 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DEBRA H., JANICE B., PAULINE, JAQUEL S., BRANDON J., AND CO-DEFENDANTS:  LONELL ECHOLS AND BRIAN ECHOLS.  COURT ALSO ORDERS CO-DEFENDANTS TO BE KEPT SEPARATE WHILE IN CUSTODY.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant George A Eskridge in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant George A Eskridge in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge KONKOL, Branch 44.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

COURT ORDERS DNA SAMPLE TO BE OBTAINED BY SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).



  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
